text: Treatment of Jurkat T-cells with PMA was more potent than HK E . coli at elevating the <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels .
PMA induced AP-1 activation and down-regulated NF-kappaB while HK E . coli up-regulated NF-kappaB without affecting AP-1 activity .

In addition , the temporal induction pattern of AP-1 correlated to the release of <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> while <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> followed the NF-kappaB activity .

Likewise , blocking NF-kappaB activation resulted in a complete inhibition of <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> while the <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels remained elevated as shown both at the protein and mRNA level .
